pull.title: test: refactor: remove unneeded bytes<->hex conversions in `byte_to_base58`
pull.body: It seems like the only reason for using hex strings in this method was to have a convenient way to convert to an integer from the input data interpreted as big-endian. In Python3 we have `int.from_bytes(..., 'big')` for that purpose, hence there is no need for that anymore and we can simply operate on bytes only.

rename.from: test: refactor: remove uneeded bytes<->hex conversions in `byte_to_base58`
rename.to: test: refactor: remove unneeded bytes<->hex conversions in `byte_to_base58`

events.body:
Code Review ACK

This PR rewrites the `byte_to_base58` function, which removes the need for **bytes <-> hex** conversion. I have manually tested the old and new code, and their results are identical.

**Screenshot:**
|Master|PR|
|---------|----|
|![Master](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85434418/153710209-c64dd9ac-4a94-4cf5-ba0f-513d81c7056a.png)|![PR](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85434418/153710317-b7a87bc2-6509-4174-87c4-c69ea194c14c.png)|


The updated code is clean and concise, and I agree that it can be merged.

events.message:
test: refactor: remove unneeded bytes<->hex conversions in `byte_to_base58`

It seems like the only reason for using hex strings in this
method was to have a convenient way to convert to an integer
from the input data interpreted as big-endian.
In Python3 we have `int.from_bytes(..., 'big')` for that
purpose, hence there is no need for that anymore and we can
simply operate on bytes only.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,17 +55,15 @@ def create_deterministic_address_bcrt1_p2tr_op_true():
 
 def byte_to_base58(b, version):
     result = ''
-    str = b.hex()
-    str = chr(version).encode('latin-1').hex() + str
-    checksum = hash256(bytes.fromhex(str)).hex()
-    str += checksum[:8]
-    value = int('0x' + str, 0)
+    b = bytes([version]) + b  # prepend version
+    b += hash256(b)[:4]       # append checksum
+    value = int.from_bytes(b, 'big')
     while value > 0:
         result = chars[value % 58] + result
         value //= 58
-    while (str[:2] == '00'):
+    while (b[0] == 0):
comments.body: Might as well remove the unnecessary parentheses here while we're at it.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,17 +55,15 @@ def create_deterministic_address_bcrt1_p2tr_op_true():
 
 def byte_to_base58(b, version):
     result = ''
-    str = b.hex()
comments.body: Oof, this was some terrible python code, thanks for improving it :smile:

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,17 +55,15 @@ def create_deterministic_address_bcrt1_p2tr_op_true():
 
 def byte_to_base58(b, version):
     result = ''
-    str = b.hex()
-    str = chr(version).encode('latin-1').hex() + str
-    checksum = hash256(bytes.fromhex(str)).hex()
-    str += checksum[:8]
-    value = int('0x' + str, 0)
+    b = bytes([version]) + b  # prepend version
+    b += hash256(b)[:4]       # append checksum
+    value = int.from_bytes(b, 'big')
     while value > 0:
         result = chars[value % 58] + result
         value //= 58
-    while (str[:2] == '00'):
+    while (b[0] == 0):
